The late legendary producer and composer died on November 3 at the age of 91 from pancreatic cancer.

Throughout his storied career, Jones worked with countless artists including Frank Sinatra , Ray Charles and Michael Jackson among others, with whom he famously produced the iconic albums 'Off The Wall', 'Thriller' and 'Bad'. 'Thriller' is still the biggest selling album of all time.

His relationship with Jackson began with The Wiz , the 1978 reimagining of The Wizard Of Oz . At the 2025 Oscars, Latifah paid tribute to Jones by performing the film's centrepiece song 'Ease On Down The Road'.

Prior to that, Goldberg and Winfrey – who co-starred in the 1985 film The Color Purple , a film produced by Jones – spoke about Jones' impact on music and popular culture. “When we talk about Black excellence, we're talking about Quincy,” Goldberg said.

“Quincy was love, lived out loud in human form. And he poured that love into others and into his work.见到他后，我的生活永远改变了。 He actually discovered me for The Color Purple , which was my first film,” Winfrey said, with Goldberg adding: “Me, too.”

Halle Berry and Adrien Brody have reunited on the Oscars red carpet, and they recreated their controversial awards moment 22 years ago.

In 2003, at the 75th Academy Awards, Brody made headlines when he won the Best Actor award for his performance in The Pianist – coming onstage to accept his award, he embraced presenter Berry in elation with a spontaneous kiss. The incident sparked criticism towards Brody for his apparent lack of consent.

22 years later, Brody – who is nominated in the same category for his lead performance in The Brutalist – was on the red carpet speaking with Access Hollywood 's Georgina Chapman when Berry huddled over.

“Sorry Georgina, I have to do this,” Berry said, before launching into a kiss with Brody. She said after: “I had to do that, I had to pay him back.” Berry is present at the ceremony to present a segment dedicated to the James Bond franchise and its producers Barbara Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson.

Through the years, both Brody and Berry have addressed the incident. Brody told Vanity Fair in 2015 that he felt like “time slowed down” when he went for it.

“I was like, 'What the fuck's happening right now?' That is what was going through my mind,” Berry said in 2017 on Watch What Happens Live .

“And because I was there the year before and I know the feeling of being out of your body, I just fucking went with it. But I was like, 'What the fuck is going on right now?'” Brody later recreated the incident with Queen Latifah at the 2003 MTV Movie Awards.
